topic: How to combine numbers with typing for production code (Python 3.12+)
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to combine numbers with typing for production code (Python 3.12+)

response_parsed.title: Combining Numbers with Typing in Python 3.12+ for Production Code
response_parsed.summary: This explainer demonstrates how to leverage the updated type hints in Python 3.12+ to combine numbers more effectively and maintain production-ready code.
key_points: Introduction of new Number types (Int, Real, Complex) for improved type checking
Improved performance through static type analysis at compile time
Reduced runtime errors due to better type annotations
Example usage of the new number types and their benefits

code_examples.code:
from typing import Int, Real

def add(a: Int, b: Real) -> Real:
    return a + b

num1: Int = 5
num2: Real = 3.14
result = add(num1, num2)

version_notes: Requires Python 3.12+ to utilize the updated type hinting features
The benefits of using these new number types become more noticeable as code complexity increases.
caveats: While these new number types can help catch errors during development, it is still important to thoroughly test your code to ensure proper functionality.
Using too many type hints may lead to verbose code and could potentially obscure the simplicity of Python.
